verses.verse: Praise <WH1984> ye the LORD <WH3050>. O give thanks <WH3034> unto the LORD <WH3068>; for he is good <WH2896>: for his mercy <WH2617> endureth for ever <WH5769>.
Who can utter <WH4448> the mighty acts <WH1369> of the LORD <WH3068>? who can shew forth <WH8085> all his praise <WH8416>?
Blessed <WH835> are they that keep <WH8104> judgment <WH4941>, and he that doeth <WH6213> righteousness <WH6666> at all times <WH6256>.
Remember <WH2142> me, O LORD <WH3068>, with the favour <WH7522> that thou bearest unto thy people <WH5971>: O visit <WH6485> me with thy salvation <WH3444>;

That I may see <WH7200> the good <WH2896> of thy chosen <WH972>, that I may rejoice <WH8055> in the gladness <WH8057> of thy nation <WH1471>, that I may glory <WH1984> with thine inheritance <WH5159>.
We have sinned <WH2398> with our fathers <WH1>, we have committed iniquity <WH5753>, we have done wickedly <WH7561>.

Our fathers <WH1> understood <WH7919> not thy wonders <WH6381> in Egypt <WH4714>; they remembered <WH2142> not the multitude <WH7230> of thy mercies <WH2617>; but provoked <WH4784> him at the sea <WH3220>, even at the Red <WH5488> sea <WH3220>.
Nevertheless he saved <WH3467> them for his name's <WH8034> sake, that he might make his mighty power <WH1369> to be known <WH3045>.
He rebuked <WH1605> the Red <WH5488> sea <WH3220> also, and it was dried up <WH2717>: so he led <WH3212> them through the depths <WH8415>, as through the wilderness <WH4057>.
And he saved <WH3467> them from the hand <WH3027> of him that hated <WH8130> them, and redeemed <WH1350> them from the hand <WH3027> of the enemy <WH341>.
And the waters <WH4325> covered <WH3680> their enemies <WH6862>: there was not one <WH259> of them left <WH3498>.
Then believed <WH539> they his words <WH1697>; they sang <WH7891> his praise <WH8416>.
They soon <WH4116> forgat <WH7911> his works <WH4639>; they waited <WH2442> not for his counsel <WH6098>:
But lusted <WH183> exceedingly <WH8378> in the wilderness <WH4057>, and tempted <WH5254> God <WH410> in the desert <WH3452>.
And he gave <WH5414> them their request <WH7596>; but sent <WH7971> leanness <WH7332> into their soul <WH5315>.
They envied <WH7065> Moses <WH4872> also in the camp <WH4264>, and Aaron <WH175> the saint <WH6918> of the LORD <WH3068>.
The earth <WH776> opened <WH6605> and swallowed up <WH1104> Dathan <WH1885>, and covered <WH3680> the company <WH5712> of Abiram <WH48>.
And a fire <WH784> was kindled <WH1197> in their company <WH5712>; the flame <WH3852> burned up <WH3857> the wicked <WH7563>.
They made <WH6213> a calf <WH5695> in Horeb <WH2722>, and worshipped <WH7812> the molten image <WH4541>.
Thus they changed <WH4171> their glory <WH3519> into the similitude <WH8403> of an ox <WH7794> that eateth <WH398> grass <WH6212>.
They forgat <WH7911> God <WH410> their saviour <WH3467>, which had done <WH6213> great things <WH1419> in Egypt <WH4714>;
Wondrous works <WH6381> in the land <WH776> of Ham <WH2526>, and terrible things <WH3372> by the Red <WH5488> sea <WH3220>.

Therefore he said <WH559> that he would destroy <WH8045> them, had not <WH3884> Moses <WH4872> his chosen <WH972> stood <WH5975> before <WH6440> him in the breach <WH6556>, to turn away <WH7725> his wrath <WH2534>, lest he should destroy <WH7843> them.
Yea, they despised <WH3988> the pleasant <WH2532> land <WH776>, they believed <WH539> not his word <WH1697>:
But murmured <WH7279> in their tents <WH168>, and hearkened <WH8085> not unto the voice <WH6963> of the LORD <WH3068>.
Therefore he lifted up <WH5375> his hand <WH3027> against them, to overthrow <WH5307> them in the wilderness <WH4057>:
To overthrow <WH5307> their seed <WH2233> also among the nations <WH1471>, and to scatter <WH2219> them in the lands <WH776>.
They joined <WH6775> themselves also unto Baal-peor <WH1187>, and ate <WH398> the sacrifices <WH2077> of the dead <WH4191>.
Thus they provoked him to anger <WH3707> with their inventions <WH4611>: and the plague <WH4046> brake in <WH6555> upon them.
Then stood up <WH5975> Phinehas <WH6372>, and executed judgment <WH6419>: and so the plague <WH4046> was stayed <WH6113>.
And that was counted <WH2803> unto him for righteousness <WH6666> unto all <WH1755> generations <WH1755> for <WH5704> evermore <WH5769>.
They angered <WH7107> him also at the waters <WH4325> of strife <WH4808> <WH4809>, so that it went ill <WH3415> with Moses <WH4872> for their sakes:
Because they provoked <WH4784> his spirit <WH7307>, so that he spake unadvisedly <WH981> with his lips <WH8193>.
They did not destroy <WH8045> the nations <WH5971>, concerning whom the LORD <WH3068> commanded <WH559> them:
But were mingled <WH6148> among the heathen <WH1471>, and learned <WH3925> their works <WH4639>.
And they served <WH5647> their idols <WH6091>: which were a snare <WH4170> unto them.
Yea, they sacrificed <WH2076> their sons <WH1121> and their daughters <WH1323> unto devils <WH7700>,

And shed <WH8210> innocent <WH5355> blood <WH1818>, even the blood <WH1818> of their sons <WH1121> and of their daughters <WH1323>, whom they sacrificed <WH2076> unto the idols <WH6091> of Canaan <WH3667>: and the land <WH776> was polluted <WH2610> with blood <WH1818>.
Thus were they defiled <WH2930> with their own works <WH4639>, and went a whoring <WH2181> with their own inventions <WH4611>.
Therefore was the wrath <WH639> of the LORD <WH3068> kindled <WH2734> against his people <WH5971>, insomuch that he abhorred <WH8581> his own inheritance <WH5159>.
And he gave <WH5414> them into the hand <WH3027> of the heathen <WH1471>; and they that hated <WH8130> them ruled <WH4910> over them.
Their enemies <WH341> also oppressed <WH3905> them, and they were brought into subjection <WH3665> under their hand <WH3027>.
Many <WH7227> times <WH6471> did he deliver <WH5337> them; but they provoked <WH4784> him with their counsel <WH6098>, and were brought low <WH4355> for their iniquity <WH5771>.
Nevertheless he regarded <WH7200> their affliction <WH6862>, when he heard <WH8085> their cry <WH7440>:
And he remembered <WH2142> for them his covenant <WH1285>, and repented <WH5162> according to the multitude <WH7230> of his mercies <WH2617>.
He made <WH5414> them also to be pitied <WH7356> of <WH6440> all those that carried them captives <WH7617>.

Save <WH3467> us, O LORD <WH3068> our God <WH430>, and gather <WH6908> us from among the heathen <WH1471>, to give thanks <WH3034> unto thy holy <WH6944> name <WH8034>, and to triumph <WH7623> in thy praise <WH8416>.

Blessed <WH1288> be the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478> from everlasting <WH5769> to everlasting <WH5769>: and let all the people <WH5971> say <WH559>, Amen <WH543>. Praise <WH1984> ye the LORD <WH3050>.
